data.title: 13-year-old to be charged as an adult in Vero Beach abduction attempts, sheriff says
data.meta_description: A 13-year-old boy will be tried as an adult after being accused of attempting to abduct three women in a Vero Beach community.
data.text:
A 13-year-old boy will be tried as an adult after being accused of in a Vero Beach community.

ThePointe West community was gripped with fear following a series of attempted abductions in late-June and July. The Indian River County Sheriff's Office (IRCSO) released photos of the assailant .

After several weeks, Sheriff Eric Flowers made an announcement to the community that the suspect has been caught after multiple neighbors recognized him through surveillance video. However, Sheriff Flowers said the suspect is a 13-year-old boy. Elijah Cartwright was booked into theDepartment of Juvenile Justice (DJJ) on one count of kidnapping.

See also:

In an update on Thursday afternoon, Sheriff Flowers saidCartwright will be charged as an adult following an indictment by a grand jury.

The teen is still incarcerated and his bond is set at $500,000.

"I know the folks of Pointe West will sleep better knowing that he is going to be charged as an adult and he has no plan to get out anytime soon," Sheriff Flowers said.
